definition: to catch sight of in a doorway (old)
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: The box can go on the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 这个盒子可以放在搁板上。

sentences.english: Mine I had snatched from my knees and held over my head, by a sort of instinct.
sentences.chinese: 思嘉从搁板上一把抓起她的宽边草帽随手扣在头上。

sentences.english: Please lift the box down from the shelf for me.
sentences.chinese: 请帮我把这只箱子从搁板上抬下来。

sentences.english: Scarlett caught up her wide straw bonnet from the console table and jammed it on her head.
sentences.chinese: 思嘉从搁板上一把抓起她的宽边草帽随手扣在头上。

sentences.english: The chime clock ticks away on the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 自鸣钟在搁板上滴答滴答地响著。

sentences.english: the attacker cracked the racks and stacked them on the track.
sentences.chinese: 进犯者打裂搁板并把它们堆在跑道上。

sentences.english: The attacker cracked the racks and stacked them on the track.
sentences.chinese: 攻击者打裂搁板并把它们堆在跑道上。

sentences.english: One has shelves and a built-in shoe rack.
sentences.chinese: 其中一个有搁板和鞋架。

sentences.english: The baggage shelf may heat up, speeding up the sublimation and reducing the dry cycle.
sentences.chinese: 搁板可加热，这样可使升华速度加快，减少干燥周期。

sentences.english: The clock ticked away on the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 时钟在搁板上滴嗒嘀嗒地响着。

definition: to receive/to accept/to take in/to hold
cupboard/cupboard that can also be used as a table/sideboard
